title: Why are there no unique "death quotes"? (i.e. Leona killed by Diana, Jinx killed by Vi, etc.)
body:
You'd think Jinx would say something special if Vi gets a kill on her, or Azir would say something if killed by Xerath, but apparently those don't exist.

Why is that? Lack of tech? Screws with people knowing if they got a kill?

replies.body: {{champion:45}} Greybeard killed by {{champion:63}}: "Fly, you fools!"

It's something that we've steadily been doing more and more of in the past couple years. There are SOOOOOOO many more interactions between Champs that we'd love to have in there today. However, the reality is, going back and recording a handful of lines for older Champs is logistically tougher than waiting for something like a Champ relaunch/update, or some kind of lore event like Shurima where a meatier script gets fleshed out.

I think as we've seen, Champ updates have gotten pretty epic lately, and I see no reason why we'd not continue to inject more of these kinds of interactions moving forward. =)
Not this specifically, though. No Champion gets special dialogue when killed by a particular other Champion, not even among the newest ones in the roster.

Ahhhhh, gotcha', I think I read your post too quickly.
